description: The Ministry of Culture has appointed Tom Remlov as new chairman and Shahzad Rana as new board member in Talent Norway. At the same time, I would like to take this opportunity to thank Chairman John G. subjectCode.description: Trading Impact (ICE Codes) Important Corporate Events

text:
The Ministry of Culture has appointed Tom Remlov as new chairman and Shahzad
Rana as new board member in Talent Norway.

I am pleased that Remlov and Rana have agreed to contribute as new chairman
and new board member in Talent Norway. Both have experience and background
that are exciting for the company's development, both in the short and long
term. At the same time, I would like to take this opportunity to thank
Chairman John G. Bernander and Board members Bjrn O. iulfstad and Cecilie
Broch Knudsen for their efforts in the Board, says Minister of Culture and
Gender Equality Abid Q. Raja.

Tom Remlov (b. 1949) has been theater director at The National Scene, CEO and
producer for Norsk Film AS, head of the production line at The Norwegian Film
School, and CEO of The Norwegian Opera & Ballet from its opening in 2008. From
2015 to April 1 this year, he was theater manager at Riksteatret.

Shahzad Rana (b. 1967) is an IT entrepreneur with computer science and
philology education, and works as technology director at Microsoft Norway. He
has made a name for himself as a debater in the media, has been one of the
judges in the TV series Creator on TV 2. chaired the Crime Prevention Council
20122014, and was a member of the Technology Council during the period
20122016. He also sits on the board of the Norwegian Theater. Talent Norge AS
was founded on January 21, 2015 by the Sparebank Foundation DNB, Cultiva -
Kristiansand Municipality's Energy Works Foundation and the state by the
Ministry of Culture.

The company's purpose is to develop the foremost artistic talents in Norway in
a collaboration between the state and private actors, and thus contribute to a
high international cultural life and several world-class artists. The Board of
Talent Norway has considerable artistic and cultural expertise and makes
thorough assessments of the projects that apply for funding, before any
awards.

title: Norway : New board members in Talent Norway [Al Bawaba Business]
html:
The Ministry of Culture has appointed Tom Remlov as new chairman and Shahzad Rana as new board member in Talent Norway.

I am pleased that Remlov and Rana have agreed to contribute as new chairman and new board member in Talent Norway. Both have experience and background that are exciting for the company's development, both in the short and long term. At the same time, I would like to take this opportunity to thank Chairman John G. Bernander and Board members Bjrn O. iulfstad and Cecilie Broch Knudsen for their efforts in the Board, says Minister of Culture and Gender Equality Abid Q. Raja.

Tom Remlov (b. 1949) has been theater director at The National Scene, CEO and producer for Norsk Film AS, head of the production line at The Norwegian Film School, and CEO of The Norwegian Opera & Ballet from its opening in 2008. From 2015 to April 1 this year, he was theater manager at Riksteatret.

Shahzad Rana (b. 1967) is an IT entrepreneur with computer science and philology education, and works as technology director at Microsoft Norway. He has made a name for himself as a debater in the media, has been one of the judges in the TV series Creator on TV 2. chaired the Crime Prevention Council 20122014, and was a member of the Technology Council during the period 20122016. He also sits on the board of the Norwegian Theater. Talent Norge AS was founded on January 21, 2015 by the Sparebank Foundation DNB, Cultiva - Kristiansand Municipality's Energy Works Foundation and the state by the Ministry of Culture.

The company's purpose is to develop the foremost artistic talents in Norway in a collaboration between the state and private actors, and thus contribute to a high international cultural life and several world-class artists. The Board of Talent Norway has considerable artistic and cultural expertise and makes thorough assessments of the projects that apply for funding, before any awards.
